directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.
directives.name: include

directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.
directives.name: skip

types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.
types.name: Boolean

types.description: Object used to abstract periods of inactivity of control devices used to control emissions from controlled compressors, rendering emissions nonroutine or fugitive during those periods as described in AER Manual 015 section [`4.2.2`](https://static.aer.ca/prd/documents/manuals/Manual015.pdf#page=29).
types.name: CompressorControlDeviceInactivity

types.description: Object representing changes to controlled or uncontrolled characterization of compressor as defined in AER Directive 060 [`Section 8.11`](https://static.aer.ca/prd/documents/directives/Directive060.pdf#page=88).
types.name: CompressorControlledCharacterization

fields.description: standard cubic feet per hour of methane
fields.name: rate

types.description:
Model representing user overrides of calculated monthly methane emission volumes from compressor seals.

Field `month` is a [`NaiveDate`](chrono::NaiveDate), which must be first day of the month. This is impossible to enforce on database level, but is instead guaranteed through [`MonthBeginningValidator`](crate::graphql::models::validators::MonthBeginningValidator).

Field `gas_volume` is in m³.

fields.description: m³ per month of natural gas
fields.name: gasVolume

types.name: CompressorSealMonthMethaneEmissionOverride

types.description:
Object representing requirement in [`AER Directive 060 section 8.6.2.1`](https://static.aer.ca/prd/documents/directives/Directive060.pdf#page=75).

Rate represents methane leak expressed in standard cubic feet per hour.

fields.description: standard cubic feet per hour of methane
fields.name: rate

types.name: CompressorSealTest

types.description: Type representing possible compressor seal testing points from AER Directive 060 section [`8.6.2.1`](https://static.aer.ca/prd/documents/directives/Directive060.pdf#page=76), AER Manual 015 section [`4.5.1`](https://static.aer.ca/prd/documents/manuals/Manual015.pdf#page=41) and [`4.5.2`](https://static.aer.ca/prd/documents/manuals/Manual015.pdf#page=42).
types.name: CompressorSealTestingPoint

types.description:
`CompressorType` is an externally defined enum inside schema, so we have to provide matching Rust type and `Display` trait implementation.

It is defined in common library so it can be used by both server and client.
types.name: CompressorType

types.description: Type representing equipment used to control vent gas as described in AER Manual 015 section [`1.1.2`](https://static.aer.ca/prd/documents/manuals/Manual015.pdf#page=10).
types.name: ControlDevice

types.description: Type representing reason for periods of inactivity of equipment used to control vent gas, rendering emissions from controlled emission sources nonroutine or fugitive during those periods as described in AER Manual 015 section [`1.1.2`](https://static.aer.ca/prd/documents/manuals/Manual015.pdf#page=10).
types.name: ControlDeviceInactivityReason

types.description: Any building, structure, installation, equipment or appurtenance over which the Regulator has jurisdiction and that is connected to or associated with the recovery, development, production, handling, processing, treatment or disposal of hydrocarbon‑based resources, including synthetic coal gas and synthetic coal liquid, or any associated substances or wastes or the disposal of captured carbon dioxide.

fields.description: As defined in Directive 047, a unique facility identification code, with 4 letters and 7 numbers (e.g., ABWP1234567), assigned by Petrinex to each facility.
fields.name: idpa

types.name: Facility

types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).
types.name: Float

types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional whole numeric values.
types.name: Int

types.description: A pneumatic device, powered by pressurized gas, used for maintaining liquid level as defined in AER Directive 060 [`Appendix 2`](https://static.aer.ca/prd/documents/directives/Directive060.pdf#page=98).
types.name: LevelController

types.description: Object used to abstract periods of inactivity of control devices used to control emissions from controlled level controllers, rendering emissions nonroutine or fugitive during those periods as described in AER Manual 015 section [`1.1.2`](https://static.aer.ca/prd/documents/manuals/Manual015.pdf#page=10).
types.name: LevelControllerControlDeviceInactivity

types.description: Object representing changes to controlled or uncontrolled characterization of level controller as defined in AER Manual 015 section [`1.1.2`](https://static.aer.ca/prd/documents/manuals/Manual015.pdf#page=10).
types.name: LevelControllerControlledCharacterization

types.description:
Model representing user overrides of calculated monthly methane emission volumes from level controllers.

Field `month` is a [`NaiveDate`](chrono::NaiveDate), which must be first day of the month. This is impossible to enforce on database level, but is instead guaranteed through [`MonthBeginningValidator`](crate::graphql::models::validators::MonthBeginningValidator).

Field `gas_volume` is in m³.
types.name: LevelControllerMonthMethaneEmissionOverride

types.description: Type representing top level categorization of methane emission sources as illustrated in AER Directive 060 [`Section 8, Figure 10`](https://static.aer.ca/prd/documents/directives/Directive060.pdf#page=71).
types.name: MethaneEmissionCategory

types.description: Type representing lowest level categorization of methane emission sources as illustrated in AER Directive 060 [`Section 8, Figure 10`](https://static.aer.ca/prd/documents/directives/Directive060.pdf#page=71).
types.name: MethaneEmissionSource

types.description: `month_methane_emission` table doesn't have a foreign key constraint for `source_table_id` column because a value from that column could be refering to a column from multiple tables. This type represents a table it is refering to.
types.name: MethaneEmissionSourceTable

types.description:
ISO 8601 calendar date without timezone.
Format: %Y-%m-%d

# Examples

* `1994-11-13`
* `2000-02-24`
types.name: NaiveDate

types.description:
ISO 8601 combined date and time without timezone.

# Examples

* `2015-07-01T08:59:60.123`,
types.name: NaiveDateTime

types.description: Pneumatic instrument excluding level controller, as defined in AER Directive 060 [`Appendix 2`](https://static.aer.ca/prd/documents/directives/Directive060.pdf#page=98).
types.name: PneumaticInstrument

types.description: Object used to abstract periods of inactivity of control devices used to control emissions from controlled pneumatic instruments, rendering emissions nonroutine or fugitive during those periods as described in AER Manual 015 section [`1.1.2`](https://static.aer.ca/prd/documents/manuals/Manual015.pdf#page=10).
types.name: PneumaticInstrumentControlDeviceInactivity

types.description: Object representing changes to controlled or uncontrolled characterization of pneumatic instrument as defined in AER Manual 015 section [`1.1.2`](https://static.aer.ca/prd/documents/manuals/Manual015.pdf#page=10).
types.name: PneumaticInstrumentControlledCharacterization

types.description:
Model representing user overrides of calculated monthly methane emission volumes from non-level controllers.

Field `month` is a [`NaiveDate`](chrono::NaiveDate), which must be first day of the month. This is impossible to enforce on database level, but is instead guaranteed through [`MonthBeginningValidator`](crate::graphql::models::validators::MonthBeginningValidator).

Field `gas_volume` is in m³.
types.name: PneumaticInstrumentMonthMethaneEmissionOverride

types.description:
`PneumaticInstrumentType` is an externally defined enum inside schema, so we have to provide matching Rust type and `Display` trait implementation.

It is defined in common library so it can be used by both server and client.
types.name: PneumaticInstrumentType

types.description:
`Role` is an externally defined enum inside schema, so we have to provide matching Rust type and `Display` trait implementation.

It is defined in common library so it can be used by both server and client.
types.name: Role

`SealType` is an externally defined enum inside schema, so we have to provide matching Rust type and `Display` trait implementation.

It is defined in common library so it can be used by both server and client.
types.name: SealType

types.description: The area defined by the boundaries of a surface lease for upstream oil and gas facilities and wells (pads counted as one lease).
types.name: Site

types.description:
`SiteType` is an externally defined enum inside schema, so we have to provide matching Rust type and `Display` trait implementation.

It is defined in common library so it can be used by both server and client.
types.name: SiteType

types.description: Object used to abstract periods of inactivity of control devices used to control emissions from controlled storage tanks, rendering emissions nonroutine or fugitive during those periods as described in AER Manual 015 section [`4.2.2`](https://static.aer.ca/prd/documents/manuals/Manual015.pdf#page=29).
types.name: StorageTankControlDeviceInactivity

fields.description: standard cubic feet per hour of methane
fields.name: rate

types.description:
Model representing user overrides of calculated monthly vented volumes from storage tanks.

Field `month` is a [`NaiveDate`](chrono::NaiveDate), which must be first day of the month. This is impossible to enforce on database level, but is instead guaranteed through [`MonthBeginningValidator`](crate::graphql::models::validators::MonthBeginningValidator).

Field `gas_volume` is in m³.
types.name: StorageTankMonthMethaneEmissionOverride

types.description:
The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8
character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to
represent free-form human-readable text.
types.name: String

types.description:
A UUID is a unique 128-bit number, stored as 16 octets. UUIDs are parsed as
Strings within GraphQL. UUIDs are used to assign unique identifiers to
entities without requiring a central allocating authority.

# References

* [Wikipedia: Universally Unique Identifier](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universally_unique_identifier)
* [RFC4122: A Universally Unique IDentifier (UUID) URN Namespace](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4122)
types.name: UUID

types.description:
`User` model is the root of every other model.

Every entry was created and updated by a `User` so the model can load an array of created or updated entries.
types.name: User

types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type
validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution
behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally
including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing
additional information to the executor.
types.name: __Directive

types.description:
A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a
__DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.
enumValues.name: QUERY

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.
enumValues.name: MUTATION

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.
enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.
enumValues.name: FIELD

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.
enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.
enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.
enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.
enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.
enumValues.name: SCHEMA

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.
enumValues.name: SCALAR

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.
enumValues.name: OBJECT

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.
enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.
enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.
enumValues.name: INTERFACE

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.
enumValues.name: UNION

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.
enumValues.name: ENUM

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.
enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.
enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.
enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION

types.name: __DirectiveLocation

types.description:
One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a
placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned
in a JSON response as a string.
types.name: __EnumValue

types.description:
Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which
has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.
types.name: __Field

types.description:
Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an
InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and
optionally a default value.
types.name: __InputValue

types.description:
A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes
all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry
points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.
fields.name: types

fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.
fields.name: queryType

fields.description:
If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will
be rooted at.
fields.name: mutationType

fields.description:
If this server support subscription, the type that subscription
operations will be rooted at.
fields.name: subscriptionType

fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.
fields.name: directives

types.name: __Schema

types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds
of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about
that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and
description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface
types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface,
provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose
other types.
types.name: __Type

types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.
enumValues.name: SCALAR

enumValues.description:
Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid
fields.
enumValues.name: OBJECT

enumValues.description:
Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are
valid fields.
enumValues.name: INTERFACE

enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.
enumValues.name: UNION

enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.
enumValues.name: ENUM

enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.
enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT

enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.
enumValues.name: LIST

enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.
enumValues.name: NON_NULL

types.name: __TypeKind
